text: - [Igor] Hi, my name is Igor Kushnirov
and I'm a Senior Solutions Architect
on the Edge Services team at AWS.
Customers often ask me,

what is shield advanced
proactive engagement
and how does it work?
And today I would like to talk

to you about the benefits
of proactive engagement
and how to configure it

using the WAF and Shield
management console.

In order to have access to
the Shield Response Team
you must be subscribed to
either Business or Enterprise support plan

and your account must be
subscribed to AWS Shield Advanced.

Once you have subscribed
to Shield Advanced service
and added resources under protection,

you can always contact
the Shield Response Team
by raising a support ticket,
or invoking the Shield Response Team
Engagement Lambda function

When you think any of the
protected resources is affected

and the current state of
your end user experience.

However, when you enable
proactive engagement
in your account

the Shield Response Team
will contact you directly

when the availability or
performance of your application
is affected because of a possible attack.

The following are the main
configuration requirements,

to assure a successful enablement
of proactive engagement.

You must set up an associate
an Amazon Route 53 Health Check
with any resource that you want to protect
with proactive engagement.
It's also important

that your health checks
accurately reflect the state
of your protected resources.
You must provide at least one contact
for the Shield Response Team to use
for proactive engagement.
During an event, you can configure
up to 10 contacts in total.

If you don't have
24-seven operation center,
you can provide a page contact

and indicate this contact
preferences in your contact notes.

During an event that's
detected by Shield Advanced,
the Shield Response Team
uses the state of your health checks
to determine whether the event
qualifies for proactive engagement.

If so, the Shield Response
Team will contact you
within 15 minutes.

According to the contact
guidance that you provide

in your proactive
engagement configuration.

Let's now turn to the
shield management console
and enable the proactive engagement.
Here I am on the overview page

and I'm gonna choose edit
and add contact details.
I'll add an email,
and a phone number.
And then in the notes,
I'll ask the Shield Response Team
to use my email during the day
and the phone number after midnight.
Allow the contact and choose save.

Then I will choose added
proactive engagement feature
choose, enable, and save.
The proactive engagement is now enabled.

Let's switch to the
protected resource page

and you can see here
that have a few resources

that have Route 53 health
check associated with them.

These are the resources
that will be monitored
using the proactive engagement.
And here's some additional resources
where you can find a template
for the Engagement Lambda function
and detailed configuration guidance
to enable proactive engagement.
And you're all set now.
Hope you found the short tutorial useful

and happy cloud computing
from all of us at AWS.
